title: Energy of a Bullet

children.value:
A bullet of mass 
$\vari{m}$
 moving horizontally with velocity 
$\vari{u}$
 meets a block of wood of mass 
$\vari{M}$
 approaching with velocity 
$\vari{U}$
 and remains embedded in it.

Show that the loss of kinetic energy is of the form

$\displaystyle \frac{1}{2} k {M+m}. $

and find $\vari{k}$ .

hints.value:
Momentum, 
$\valuedef{\vtr {p}}{m\vtr {v}}{}$
, is always conserved in collisions; the total before a collision equals the total after, taking care of the directions.
